research.headline: Built on credible research, enhanced with AI for clarity
research.description: Indian Financial Calculator uses carefully curated, India-focused research for each asset class. We summarize complex assumptions into clear defaults so you can move fast, while staying transparent about how numbers are derived. AI helps synthesize sources and keep explanations concise and consistent.
research.financial: Scenario-based 5Y expected CAGR for equity categories, debt regimes post-2023, gold (spot/ETF/SGB), and REITs/InvITs. Tax models and payout assumptions are applied where relevant to estimate post-tax outcomes.
research.real_estate: City and pan-India residential appreciation estimates with rental yield defaults. Agricultural land baseline appreciation and lease yield defaults. Commercial properties include cap rate regimes, NOI growth, vacancy cycles, and capex allowances for realistic projections.
research.rental_yield: We estimate net rental yield starting from gross rent, then apply realistic frictions to reach NOI (net operating income).
research.precious_metals: Scenario bands for precious metals and alternative assets. We translate instrument-level costs (ETF expense, tracking) and wrappers (SGB coupon/basis) into expected return ranges.
research.depreciating_assets: Age-based depreciation curves with floors and usage adjustments. Vehicles include segment-specific baselines, EV battery health considerations, and km/year/accident modifiers.

methodology.evidence: Defaults are anchored to Indian indices, RBI publications, market data, and reputable industry reports.
methodology.scenario: We present bear/base/bull bands and compute scenario-weighted expectations to avoid point-estimate overconfidence.
methodology.transparent: We show a short "Assumptions" explainer where it matters and let you override in Advanced controls if desired.
methodology.ai: AI helps synthesize sources, maintain consistency, and explain assumptions. It does not replace human judgment or your personal circumstances.

deposits.track_interest: Recommendation: Avoid treating savings account interest as fixed monthly income — with slab-based rates that can change anytime and based on balances. Since balances are volatile with frequent cash flows, the actual interest varies.

deposits.pomis_tenure: POMIS tenure is 5 years. Maturity date is acquisition date + 60 months.
deposits.nsc_info: NSC is cumulative; interest is paid at maturity.
deposits.kvp_info: KVP is cumulative; interest is realized via maturity value. Choose a maturity date; tenure varies with notified interest rate.

nps.tier_info: Add both Tier 1 and Tier 2 in one go. Each tier will be saved separately.
nps.expected_return: Suggested Expected CAGR for NPS: {{percent}}% (blended default). Tap magic to apply.
nps.annuity_purchase: Per PFRDA, minimum annuity purchase at exit is {{percent}}% of corpus. Early exit before age 60 typically requires 80% annuity.
nps.annuity_rate: Typical annuity rates are ~6%–8% p.a. Adjust based on the insurer/scheme you intend to select.

payables.nudge_main: Want to track payments tied to a loan or credit line? Use the Add Liability flow instead.
payables.nudge_desc: Payables are best for standalone bills, subscriptions, taxes and fees that are not part of a liability.

facility_info: Line of Credit (LOC) and Overdraft (OD) are revolving facilities with a sanctioned limit. You draw, repay, and redraw within the limit. Interest is charged only on the utilized amount and usually debited monthly.
• LOC: General-purpose revolving limit (secured or unsecured). Good for flexible cash flow.
• Overdraft: Often linked to current/savings accounts; similar mechanics. Some products have interest-only servicing with flexible principal repayment.
Pick either based on how your NBFC/bank labels the facility. This app tracks snapshot metrics like limit, outstanding, APR, utilization, and renewal reminders.
liability.review_date_info: Used to remind you to renew OD/LOC with the bank; safe to leave blank.
liability.credit_card_warning: Note: Do not use this to track credit cards. Credit cards are operational with frequent transactions, statement cycles, average daily balance interest, fees and rewards that vary monthly. This app does not model those workflows; use your issuer app for operational tracking. Use this screen for Lines of Credit or Overdraft facilities where a snapshot of limit, outstanding, and rate is sufficient.

vehicles.car: Assuming 12,000 km/year and no accident history for cars.
vehicles.two_wheeler: Assuming 6,000 km/year and no accident history for two-wheelers.
vehicles.commercial: Assuming 25,000 km/year and no accident history for commercial vehicles.

fd.helper_notes: Notes: For payout FDs, interest is paid out periodically and principal is returned at maturity. For cumulative FDs, interest is compounded and paid at maturity. Inflation adjustment is shown only for maturity-only payouts.
fd.multiplier_copy: For every ₹1 you locked in, the bank added more by maturity. That is the advantage of fixed deposits.

rd.helper_notes: Notes: RD assumes monthly contributions. Post Office RD credits interest quarterly. In India, most banks usually compound/credit RD interest quarterly. Growth view shows deposits each month and interest credited at the appropriate cadence.
rd.multiplier_copy: For every ₹1 you deposited, the bank added more in interest. That is the power of disciplined recurring saving.

sip.chart_cost_of_delay: Delaying your SIP by 5 years reduces your final corpus dramatically. The gap below shows how much wealth you leave on the table.
sip.chart_power_of_compounding: In the early years most of the value is what you invest. After year 8–10, the interest portion starts to dominate and the curve bends upwards.

ppf.helper_notes: Notes: PPF allows flexible contributions during the year; interest is credited annually. This tool shows projected maturity and growth. Tenure default is 15 years.
ppf.multiplier_copy: For every ₹1 you saved, the Govt added ₹2. That is the power of tax-free compounding!
ppf.inflation_chart: The blue bar shows what your maturity is worth in today's money.

ssy.helper_notes: Notes: SSY contributions are monthly (flexible) and interest is credited annually at year-end. Long lock-in applies; this tool focuses on growth and maturity projection only.
ssy.timeline_invalid: Account timeline: Deposits allowed for the first 15 years. Growth-only period: years 16–21 (no deposits). Maturity: end of year 21.
ssy.timeline: Account timeline: Deposits allowed for the first {{depositYears}} years. Growth-only period: years {{growthFromYear}}–{{maturityYear}} (no deposits). Maturity: end of year {{maturityYear}}.
ssy.lockin_main: Lock-in: Partial withdrawal is allowed when she turns 18 (subject to rules). Maturity is at 21 years from opening.
ssy.lockin_early: Opening earlier means a longer lock-in, but also more years for compounding before she turns 18.
ssy.lockin_edge: Because you are opening around age 10, the lock-in is only about 8 years until she turns 18.

epf.helper_notes: Notes: EPF contributions include Employee, VPF and Employer (EPF/EPS). EPS goes to pension and does not form part of the EPF corpus. Interest is credited annually; this tool approximates monthly accrual with year-end credit.

apy.info_text: APY tables are defined by PFRDA. We look up the nearest entry-age row for the selected pension slab. Actual official table is discrete by age; for precise values, refer to your bank’s APY matrix.

nps.helper_notes: Notes: NPS Tier I follows PFRDA rules. Minimum annuity purchase applies at retirement (e.g., 40% at 60). Small-corpus exemption allows full withdrawal if corpus is under the threshold.
nps.expected_return: Expected Return is a long-term blended assumption based on your chosen profile and historical NPS ranges. You can adjust it anytime. The magic icon resets to the default (10%).
nps.chart_power: Employee + Employer + Top-up vs Interest over time

swp.chart_breakeven_hit: By year {{year}}, you have withdrawn your entire initial capital. Anything left after that is pure profit.
swp.chart_breakeven_not_hit: Within this term, you do not fully withdraw your initial capital.
swp.chart_sustainability_depleted: At this withdrawal rate, your funds run out around year {{year}}.
swp.chart_sustainability_safe: At this withdrawal rate, your capital stays intact for the full term.

bond.helper_notes: Price is present value of coupons and redemption discounted at the yield. Semi-annual/quarterly compounds adjust coupon and discounting accordingly.
bond.chart_income: Annual cashflows (coupons + redemption) over bond life

emi.helper_notes: Note: Reducing balance loans calculate interest on the remaining principal; fixed interest loans use simple interest throughout the term.
emi.extras_disabled_hint: Note: For flat-interest loans and when solving for interest rate for reducing-balance loans, step-up EMIs and prepayments are disabled and not applied in the calculation.

common.cta_check_sip: FDs are safe, but inflation eats your value. Check our SIP calculator for higher returns.
